intro: Senecio nyikensis var. hildebrandtii, commonly known as the Hildebrandt's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
